comment.body: @Binchan: I think I'm at home in a few days, then I'll be able to publish it.
Cool! Where can I download this theme? Another idea: you can use some CSS3 attribute and invert icons, because right now they are hardly ever noticed.
@Binchan: Yeah, now I found it in your repo. Thanks for the theme! BTW, may I add your changes as another standard theme for Git Center?
@Binchan: Could you please also set input color to white? http://127.0.0.1:43110/1SunAWK2VUT9GQK32MpwRfFPVgcBSJN9a/data/users/1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di/darktheme.png
I've sent some issues to your messy repo.

@Binchan: There is a problem in ZeroMessage + dark theme where some rows are white. http://127.0.0.1:43110/1SunAWK2VUT9GQK32MpwRfFPVgcBSJN9a/data/users/1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di/zeromessage-dark.jpg
@Binchan: Another bug on Git Center: issues are highlighted correctly, but not pull requests.
@Binchan: I use Chrome, Stylish.

@Binchan: Should it look this way?
http://127.0.0.1:43110/18r929Hq8hE5Pi9Zf7ovMQVyn3WcGfxMgu/gitcenter-tag-darktheme.png
@Binchan: Also, PRs aren't highlighted as issues.
I've tried, thanks for an idea. Though, nothing changed.
@Binchan: That's looking good now, perhaps you fixed this.
Yeah, there was a bug I fixed now. I would like to see RVRE there too. I talked to its author about a week ago, but he didn't answer. :(
@Binchan: @Krixano: I answered on Git Center.

Perhaps that's not the correct way. I recommend you to remove remote .git folder with `rm -rf thunderwawe.git`, then `mkdir thunderwawe.git && cd thunderwawe.git && git init --bare` which will create a new repository from scratch, then run `git remote add zeronet path_to_zeronet/data/1EjXEyudstY8dN3F8V5od9KoS1bkAerz9x/thunderwawe.git && git push zeronet --all` on your local copy which will send commits to Git Center. Then try to sign & publish repository as usual.

---

If there is still a error like `Content too large`, you can navigate to `http://127.0.0.1:43110/1EjXEyudstY8dN3F8V5od9KoS1bkAerz9x/1` (`/1` prevents from redirecting) and change size setting in sidebar.

---

Unfortunately, there isn't a way to do this with ZeroFrame API, so you have to use sidebar.
@Glightstar: I somewhy cannot download your repo. Could you please resign it?
@Glightstar: There is nothing notification. Perhaps ZeroNet shows `A new version of this page was just released`.
@Glightstar: @Krixano: I still have `content.json download failed`.
@Glightstar: Could you please send me your `content.json`?

@Glightstar:
> Soooooooooooooooooooooooo
> 
> I deleted the both files in /thunderwave.git/objects/pack, and it works now!
>
> I'll just try to push/pull/whatever to the bare-repo

Not the best way, though. Instead, you should cd into remote repository and do https://stackoverflow.com/questions/16972031/how-to-unpack-all-objects-of-a-git-repository there.
@Krixano: Perhaps he used `git filter-branch`.
@Glightstar: Because `bfg-repo-cleaner` rewrites all history, so your repository and old forks have different roots, and `git merge` isn't able to merge them.
@Binchan: I told @Nofish: that files with spaces don't work, but he said `who cares`.

@Binchan: @Nofish: Uhm, sorry. But then, what's this:

> It should work, can you please check the log/debug.log after the signing? (btw the files should match "^[a-zA-Z0-9_@=\.\+\-/]+$", so white space is not allowed yet)
> https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/issues/961

?
@Binchan: Then my comment about `who cares` still applies. @Nofish: ?
@Nofish: That's fine. Thank you!
Nice! Thanks.
Looks great!
Did you publish this to Git Center? Your messy repo doesn't seem to get updated.

@Krixano: @Glightstar: Yep, when there are many clients typing, ZeroNet will probably fail to download files changing every second. Also, this marker won't be realtime because of *a)* one publish in 30 sec limit *b)* recursive publish instead of publishing to each peer.
@Glightstar: How is it more secure?
For me, search bar (and all other inputs) have black text. Could you please `color: white !important` them all?
@Glightstar: Why not old?
Cool!
@Nekololi: :D
Works now!
Yep. Had such idea but then forgot.
Done.
Checked theme. Works nicely!
Yep, it is. Very odd.
Signed it again. Please check ?
@Binchan: Is that file from `Git Center` or its repository?

@Binchan: Here are files: [link](/1CodEr7T9xNXSPcwbsvf5fHTqsixDMwDzL/?1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di/0). Or at [NullPaste](/1MgHVPCE1ve6QfKrgsqCURzRj72HrRWioz/?1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di_1).
@Binchan: what do you mean by `doesn't work`?
@Binchan: Also, that sha256sum is in `content.json`, and those are original files.
@Binchan: Maybe ZeroNet does something with newlines?
@Binchan: That's strange because sha512 matches.
@Binchan: Size matches too (though there are \r\n, not \n, maybe that's why your copy-paste didn't work)
@Binchan: And if replace `\r\n` back to `\n`? I am not sure what is the problem. I used an online service to check sha512 and it matched.
